questionText: What is the main() function in a C program?
options: It is a function that must always print text to the screen
It is the entry point for program execution, where its work begins
It is a special function for handling mathematical calculations
It is an optional function that can be omitted

questionText: Which symbol must necessarily terminate every statement in C?
options: Period (.)
Colon (:)
Comma (,)
Semicolon (;)

questionText: What is the purpose of the preprocessor directive #include <stdio.h> in the first program?
options: To declare the main() function
To tell the compiler that the program uses input/output library capabilities
To make the program shorter
To print the text "Hello, World" to the screen

questionText: What is a literal in the C language?
options: It is a language keyword, for example, return
It is the name of a variable or function
It is a fixed value that is written directly into the code (e.g., a number or a string)
It is an instruction for the compiler

questionText: What is the primary purpose of using comments in a program?
options: To speed up program execution
To provide textual explanations for programmers, which are ignored by the compiler
To declare new variables
To perform additional calculations

questionText: What does a code block in C represent?
options: A single statement terminated by a semicolon
A group of statements enclosed in curly braces {}
A preprocessor directive
A function call, such as printf()

questionText: Why is it recommended to break a large program into multiple files (.h and .c)
options: To make the program run faster.
So the compiler can ignore unnecessary parts of the code
For better organization, ease of maintenance, and code reusability
It is a requirement of the C language; without it, the program will not compile
